required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Recovery After Surgery Protocol in Improving Quality of Life in Participants With Stage 0-IIIC Gastric Cancer Undergoing Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Gastric Cancer Enhanced Recovery After Surgery Pathway

brief_summary.textblock: This phase II trial studies how well an early recovery after surgery protocol works in enhancing quality of life in participants with stage 0-IIIC gastric cancer undergoing surgery. The early recovery after surgery protocol may decrease pain and nausea, promote bowl function, decrease the number of days hospitalized, and improve a participant's ability to function normally after surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Determine how the enhanced recovery after surgery (ERAS) protocol affects patient?s length of hospital stay after radical gastrectomy.
II. Determine the association between ambulation (number of steps taken) while hospitalized and complications.
III. Determine the association between pre-operatively and postoperatively drawn biochemical markers and complications, disease free survival, and overall survival.
OUTLINE:
Participants complete standard of care early recovery after surgery protocol beginning the day before surgery to day 6 after surgery.
After completion of study, participants are followed up at days 14, 30, 80-110, and 170-200, and at 11-14 months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from date of surgery to discharge from hospital, assessed up to 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Will determine the length of hospital stay after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Rate and type of post-operative complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One time within 30 days of surgery, One time within 30 days after surgery, One time at 3 months after surgery, One time 6 months after surgery, One time 12 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaires to measure Quality of life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One time within 30 days of surgery, One time within 30 days after surgery, One time at 3 months after surgery, One time 6 months after surgery, One time 12 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: STO22 questionnaires to measure stomach cancer surgery related QoL

other_outcome.time_frame: From time of surgery to first postoperative clinic visit, assessed up to 30 days
other_outcome.description: Number of steps taken after surgery as measured by a podometer

other_outcome.time_frame: one time 30 days within surgery, One time 1 day after surgery, One time 3 days after surgery, One time 30 days after surgery, One time 90 days after surgery, one time 6 months after surgery, One time 12 months after surgery
other_outcome.description: Blood levels of hsCRP will be measured before and after surgery to determine its relationship to complications and recurrence

other_outcome.measure: Disease free survival of enrolled patients

arm_group.description: Participants complete standard of care early recovery after surgery protocol beginning the day before surgery to day 6 after surgery.

intervention.description: Complete standard of care enhanced recovery after surgery protocol

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a biopsy proven diagnosis of gastric adenocarcinoma who are undergoing curative gastric surgery or prophylactic total gastrectomy for genetic risk

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients to be included are those with a biopsy proven diagnosis of gastric adenocarcinoma who are undergoing curative gastric surgery or prophylactic total gastrectomy for genetic risk.
- Patients with clinical stage 0-IIIC will be included.
- Any performance status and any life expectancy.
- The effects of gastric surgery on the developing fetus are unknown. For this reason, women of childbearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control or abstinence) prior to study entry and for six months following duration of study participation. Should a woman become pregnant or suspect that she is pregnant while participating on the trial, she should inform her treating physician immediately.
- All subjects must have the ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent.
- Prior therapy will not be used as a limitation in this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be excluded if they are not candidates for surgery
- Patients will be excluded from the study if they have had prior gastric surgery, with the exception of a gastrostomy tube.
- Subjects, who in the opinion of the investigator, may not be able to comply with the safety monitoring requirements of the study.
